nuhker

Class ParseGSB

  • java.lang.Object
    • nuhker.ParseGSB

  • public class ParseGSB
extends java.lang.Object
    The data engine we use - GSB (Google Safe Browsing) - is a reputation service to indicate whether an internet site is clean or is it contaminated by the malware. This particular exercise ignores dates; "listed on GSB" means for us - "has been contaminated by malware within last 90 days" and thus suspicious. created Nov 28, 2014 8:56:32 AM
    Author:
    coder037@xyz.ee

    • Method Detail

      • badReputation

        static java.lang.String[] badReputation(java.lang.String source)
        The method is axial to the whole package. The name of a network resource is being checked against the Google SafeBrowsing Interface (a reputation service).
        Parameters:
        source - - a target which reputation is to be checked could be 1 of 3: a FQDN (xyz.ee/) or URL (xyz.ee/X/) or ASN (AS:12345)
        Returns:
        array containing references to the badness. Should be clear that this is not we inventing badness. This is what Google thinks. We are not too precise within this experiment, we are satisfied with the 90 last days precision offered.
        Throws:
        There - are chances that Google will modify the page format. If so, hopefully this exception remembers us about the possibility.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        main method is mostly kept here for debugging purposes.
        Parameters:
        args - none expected, none used
